result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle D. Gustum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall obtain his GED, HSED or High School Diploma.

Defendant shall submit a DNA sample. Defendant shall attend counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
Shall commence on or before May 14, 2017 at 4:30 p.m.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs. 

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Taylor Co. Case No. 13CF102

records.addlTxt: Court calls case Nos. 13CF102, 15CF60, 15CF67,15CF97,16CF80.  Defendant Kyle D. Gustum in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tlusty places agreement on the record. 15CF67 - DE enters a plea of no contest to Ct. 1 & 4.; 16CF80 - DE enters a plea of no contest to Ct. 1, 2, & 5. 16TR541 & 16TR544 - DE enters a plea of no contest to each citation.  Plea colloquy. Factual basis exists.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepts plea; found DE guilty.  Argument on jail sentence.  DE makes statement on sentence.  13CF102 - Court revoked Deferred Entry of Judgment on Ct. 1, withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 3 years with the following conditions:  3 months county jail with Huber;  court costs; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; obtain GED, HSED or High School Diploma.  15CF67 - Court withheld sentence on Ct. 1 and placed DE on probation for 3 years with the following conditions: 3 months county jail with Huber, concurrent to 13CF102; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; payment of $25 DA service of process fees; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; obtain GED, HSED or High School Diploma.  Ct. 4 - Court imposed court costs; DNA sample.  Court read in and dismissed Cts. 2 & 3.  15CF80 - Court withheld sentence on Ct. 1 and placed DE on probation for 3 years with the following conditions: 6 months county jail with Huber concurrent to 13CF102 & 15CF67; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to Det. Balsis due within 30 days and pre-approved by agent; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; obtain GED, HSED or High School Diploma. Ct. 2 - Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 3 years with the following conditions: 12 months county jail with Huber, concurrent to Ct. 1 and 15CF67 & 13CF102; court costs; DNA sample; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; obtain GED, HSED or High School Diploma.  Ct. 5 - Court imposed courts costs; DNA sample. Court read in, but dismissed Cts. 3 & 4.  16TR541 - Court found DE guilty and imposed the forfeiture of $213.10.  16TR544 - Court found DE guilty and imposed the forfeiture of $243.10.  Court dismissed, but read in 15CF60 and 15CF97.  Court dismissed citations 15TR722, 16TR542, & 16TR543. - ba

Defendant Kyle D. Gustum in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Tlusty requests that bond be set the same as the previous bond that was revoked.   Court orders a $2,000.00 signature bond; bookign and no possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid prescription; shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  No objection by Attorney Nocco.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant Kyle D. Gustum in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was in court for a bond hearing for new charges.  Attorney Tlusty requested that the clerk begin bond revocation proceedings in defendant's current criminal cases.  The court granted Attorney Tlusty's request for the clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings.  - rt
